  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-15172].
  {panel}

I followed these guidelines, but this is not fine grained enough.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Global+Permissions+Overview#GlobalPermissionsOverview-confluenceadmin

We need to prevent space admin adding new permission to their space.
We prefer to manage space permission by the confluence-adminitrators

The reason is that users (including space admins) are not aware of all the users that have access to confluence.
As an example, the RH users will see only RH space, so they (wrongly) beleive that confluence is for RH only and when someone does not have access to their space, they add the 'confluence-users' group with at least 'view' permissions.

We first try to train/limit the number of people, but after 6 months, this was such a mess that we decided to remove all space admin permission.
Currentlyn confluence-administrators (ie IT) are under pressure because they need to:
- communicate about who has which permission
- do all the other space admin (layout, unrestrict a page).

Therefore, I would like to have the 'admin' permission split into 2 permissions:
- 'admin' except edit permission
- edit space admin permissions
The users with 'edit space admin' permissions would be the only ones entitled to add new users/groups in the permission form.
fields.summary: Partial space admin permission/authority

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-15160].
  {panel}

For large confluence installation it is important to have RemoteAPI access to Confluence, but at the same time, it is not desirable to give the remote access to everyone and everywhere. For this reason a new permission that would control access to the remote API is needed. 

It is unimaginable to have Confluence admins of big instances decide who should get the remote api access and for which space. Such a decision should be delegated to the space admins, which are the content owners for the given space and can make a qualified decision about the access via the RemoteAPI for their space.

For this reason a new space permission is needed. This space permission would be controlled as any other permission via the Space Admin -> Permissions view.

A patch with this functionality was developed against Confluence 2.x and the patch provided is rebased for 2.10.2. Patch was written in a minimalistic way in order to introduce minimal performance penalty and make it easy to port it between different confluence versions.

In our case we wanted to restrict access to global remote api calls only to confluence admins as well, so we created a patch for that too (attached as remote-api-admin-authorization.patch). It would be nice if this patch was rewritten so that an individual global permission to access these global methods exists too, but this isn't as important for us as having the space permission patch accepted to the confluence source base. I'm attaching both patches just to give you an idea of what we do. It's up to you if you decide to take the admin patch and rewrite it so that a global permission exists as well.

The order in which patches should be applied to confluence source base is {{remote-api-admin-authorization.patch}} -> {{remote-api-authorization.patch}}.
fields.summary: Remote API Access Space Permission (PATCH)
RemoteAPI Authentication and Custom Authenticators Improvements (PATCH)

When a user has a current status update, it is displayed prominently on the Profile page in a big grey panel.

When the status has been cleared, there is no obvious info provided by the UI to show that this has been done (other than the absence of the panel).

The Profile page should indicate when the User Status is empty. This would be particularly needed in the case where the administrator clears/deletes a user's status. Possibly the UI should also indicate who did it.

The Status Update page should also distinguish between a Status Update which is the current one, and one which is the most recently entered, but is not the current one.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-15066].
  {panel}

Please make it possible to disable Confluence's hotkeys on a per-user basis in user account preferences.

When entering text in most web browsers on MacOSX (in fact in most applications on MacOSX), the following control-key combinations are already claimed for editing shortcuts:

Ctrl-A (move to beginning of line)
Ctrl-E (move to end of line)
Ctrl-D (kill next character)
Ctrl-K (kill to end of line)
Ctrl-Y (paste killed characters)
Ctrl-P (move to previous line)
Ctrl-N (move to next line)
Ctrl-B (move to previous character)
Ctrl-F (move to next character)
and probably others.

Many users, especially programmers who are used to these key combinations from thousands of hours in Emacs, habitually use these shortcuts to quickly navigate and edit text. The fact that Confluence (and evidently other Atlassian applications, as I just discovered while entering this issue and accidentally typed "Ctrl-B") overrides these fundamental text editing shortcuts with its own makes it extremely painful to compose large amounts of text in the browser.

It is so bad that typically I resort to copying the contents of a Confluence page that I am editing into a text editor, edit the text, and then paste it back into the browser. This is because it is incredibly inconvenient when the cursor jumps to another text field or the page navigates away from what I am editing (in the middle of typing), simply because I am trying to use one of the above standard MacOSX text entry shortcuts.
fields.summary: Allow hotkeys to be disabled in user account preferences

  {panel}

In Confluence 3.0, when a Page Comparison is first displayed, each substantial section of unchanged text is hidden and reduced to an ellipsis *' . . . '*. Each one of these hidden sections acts as a 'toggle', such that:
* Clicking one of these ellipses reveals and expands its hidden text
* Clicking an expanded section of text hides and contracts it back to an ellipsis

However, for Tech Writers and people who wish to browse through the entire page of text (since context can be very important), having to click on each ellipsis of a Page Comparison to reveal the entire content could be potentially irritating.

Hence, it would be great to have an 'Expand All' / 'Collapse All' function on this page, such that:
* Clicking 'Expand All' would expand all hidden text sections on the Page Comparison
* Clicking 'Collapse All' would hide these sections again
fields.summary: Page Comparisons - please add an 'Expand All' / 'Collapse All' function to these pages.

I did a large "cleanup" of a wiki site where I identified lots of pages having no or trivial content. These page were to be deleted. 

Some of these pages however had important attachments, but this fact is not easily visible. You see it only if you use the drop-down menu. In earlier Confluence releases there was a list of attachments displayed at the bottom of the page so it was more obvious at that time.

It would be nice if the standard warning, which is shown on deleting a page ("Are you sure you want to send this page to the trash?"), includes something like "This page contains n attachments". The amount of work to implement this one extra status line is probably trivial but it would add a significant value to the product.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14888].
  {panel}

From [Tom Wolff's post|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=32620&tstart=0] on the Confluence forum:

{quote}
One of the most powerful aspects of Confluence is its email notification of new and changed content. I'm sure this matter has been discussed previously, but I didn't find readily a forum posting that summarizes the issues as my wiki users and I see them.

The problem is that users receive too many email notifications that most people consider unhelpful at best and very annoying at worst. The control mechanisms currently available in Confluence 2.10 are inadequate to control sending email notifications, and "watch" options available to users can not make up for this deficiency.

I think we can divide actions and content into new, edited and removed pages, comments, news, and attachments as summarized below:

Content Type 	New 	Edited 	Removed
Page 	- 	X 	-
Comment 	- 	- 	-
News 	- 	- 	-
Attachment 	- 	- 	-


The X shows the only option, as far as I can tell, for preventing sending email notifications.

Per this chart, email notifications are automatically sent out for all combinations EXCEPT for edited pages based on whether users check the "Minor Change?" option box. (Searching the Confluence forum for "minor change" provides several conversations on this matter back at least to 2006.)

We find particularly annoying email notifications resulting from removing content. As administrator, I have removed pages, comments, and attachments as inappropriate or obsolete and have almost certainly not wanted to bring attention to that removed content.

We also believe email notifications about attachments (added, moved, or removed) to be of very low value. Attachments are almost always supporting or described by the page content itself which will be the subject of its own email notification.

My users and I believe it is past time for Atlassian to provide users and administrators better control in Confluence over sending these email notifications. This includes, but is not limited to, improving the "Minor Change?" option with clear option buttons or similar mechanisms as discussed in other forum entries.

I look forward to elaboration of this issue by other users and action by Atlassian on this matter. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Better control of email notifications for new, changed, and removed content

The "Email Page" feature, which ships with Confluence as a disabled bundled plugin, also does not send page attachments with the email.  The UI does not mention this.  Ideally it would allow users to choose which attachments are sent.

From [Mark DeSimone's post|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=32629&tstart=0] on the Confluence Forum:

We have a lot of users who travel and do work offline. So, they need to have the wiki pages and any relevant attachments in an email so when they get on the plane or train, they can work on the issue. The problem we are having is:

When a page is emailed, either from a watch or emailing it from tools, we need to have it include attachments

Are there any solutions? If not, what are some ways around it? Right now I am having trouble with adoption because everyone still likes to use Office documents and email, even if it gets a little crazy.

Improve the page "Remove" functionality:

Currently the process to remove pages is labourious, particularly when having to remove multiple pages. I can appreciate not wanting to promote the removal of pages, but it is a necessary evil, and should be easier to do. My suggestions are:

1) Prompt to also remove or relocate child pages when deleting a parent. This would be a big improvement on its own.
2) Have a checkbox somewhere on the "Browse Pages" section to allow removing multiple pages in one action. Currently we have to navigate to a page, click "remove", confirm, we're redirected to the space homepage..... Rinse and repeat for multiple deletions :-(
3) Make the process an ajax enabled one, thereby minimising the time spent doing so
4) somewhere on the "Browse Pages" allow us to drag and drop pages onto a trsh can icon

Confluence still uses an uninstalled theme's layout (eg. the font will still be the old plugin's font) as its site layout although the plugin has been uninstalled.

Steps to replicate:
# Install a theme plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14815].
  {panel}

If images are too large to fit into PDF page, they are not scaled down. Currently xsl-fo transformation includes only 96 dpi to 72 dpi scaling. It assumes that image will fit to page in any case. But after this scaling this doesn't mean that image still will fit to page. It is possible to use "scale-down-to-fit" value of content-width and content-height attributes. The below patch scales down image if needed to fit PDF page. Of course 96 dpi to 72 dpi scaling is not performed in this case.

{code:xml}
        <!-- If no size parameters are specified, scale the image by width to fit -->
        <xsl:if test="not(@width) and not(@height)">
            <!-- scale the image itself
            <xsl:attribute name="content-width">75%</xsl:attribute>
            <xsl:attribute name="content-height">75%</xsl:attribute>
            -->
            <!-- isn't it easier to specify just scale-down-to-fit if needed? -->
            <xsl:attribute name="content-width">scale-down-to-fit</xsl:attribute>
            <xsl:attribute name="content-height">scale-down-to-fit</xsl:attribute>
            <xsl:attribute name="width">100%</xsl:attribute>
            <xsl:attribute name="height">100%</xsl:attribute>
        </xsl:if>
{code}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14767].
  {panel}

Currently Confluence embeds a missing image as a placeholder for movies and missing images.  I assume it used to be in the product and just got accidentally deleted at some stage.

I'm about to fix it to link to /icons/attachments/image.gif which is a very small image which we use as the icon for image attachments in the attachments screen etc.

We need a better image.  Preferably something reasonably large (eg 64px) that looks good at a wide variety of sizes and aspect ratios.

After discussion with Stephen, it would be much better to have different placeholder images for movies and for missing images.  This will require a fix to renderer and will not fit into 3.0.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14675].
  {panel}

Edit a confluence page in Word, save the word document back to Confluence.
The width of the text displayed in the body of the page is now greater than default page width.

Attached are two screen snips - one showing the page content after returning from Word edit, the other showing the same line of text entered in the RTF editor.

You can see that the RTF editor formats the column wrap width correctly, the word does not.
fields.summary: Content returned from Edit in Word loses page width formatting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14673].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Currently, changing the text colour requires the use of a drop down. Adding emoticons, among other things, brings up a popup window. Popup windows are generally less usable than drop downs - if someone changes tabs and then comes back to the Confluence tab, the popup window has disappeared. It takes a while to find it again.

Discovered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Put add table, emoticons and custom characters into drop downs. If this is not appropriate, put them into dialog boxes.

h3. Reason for severity

Pop-up window problems were frequently encountered during user sessions.
fields.summary: In the RTE, some options are in less-usable pop-up windows when they could be in drop-downs.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14672].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Deleting and moving horizontal rules is difficult for some users.

Observed during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Give users the ability to select the horizontal rule so they can delete and move it to a different position with more ease.

h3. Reason for severity

The source of some user frustration.
fields.summary: In the RTE, Horizontal rules are difficult to delete and move

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14668].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

The functionality isn't made clear enough. When dragging and dropping, the only feedback is the cursor moving to a different line location. This often goes without being noticed and some users don't even think that dragging and dropping is possible.

Observed during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Use similar feedback to the Dashboards UI.

h3. Reason for severity

Makes it harder for users to organise their page how they would like to. Some users were observed to give up entirely.
fields.summary: Dragging and dropping images in the RTE has insubstantial feedback

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14664].
  {panel}

There have been customer questions about whether it is possible to customise the PDF header and footer with dependence on the user language.

One customer is told [on this CAC page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customise+Adobe+PDF+Exports?focusedCommentId=180292149#comment-180292149] and [this CAC page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Create+PDF+in+another+language?focusedCommentId=180291840#comment-180291840] that it is not possible to do that.

Another customer is told in [this forum post|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257300339&tstart=0#257300339] that it is possible.

We should confirm the correct answer, and provide it in the FAQs, and link the existing questions to it.
fields.summary: Internationalisation of PDF headers & footers
Allow popular labels to be listed from multiple spaces
Cannot split word document by headings on import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14655].
  {panel}

Currently confluence controls the visibility of email addresses for all accounts in the "General Configuration" section. 
While this is a good thing to have, I think a user should be allowed to change that policy for his own email address.  
I would expect to find an option in the user profile section saying:

Email visibility:  [visible] [obfuscated] [hidden]  that would allow the user to override the system-wide setting.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Allow individual users to control the visibility mode of their email address
RecacheOnWritePropertySet should only cache and persist changed values
QuickNav improvement: Add support for spacekey
Please officially support the Metadata plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14622].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

For example, "Renin" suggested "resin" instead of the user "Renan". As with any search algorithm, Did-you-mean doesn't always find the right result immediately. In one case, Did-you-mean even redirected the user to a blank results page. In these cases, the functionality was rendered useless.

Encountered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Increase the number of suggestions to 2 or 3 to increase the probability of Did-you-mean suggesting the right result. 

h3. Reason for severity

Can lead to dead ends for users.
fields.summary: Did-you-mean doesn't always suggest the right thing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14621].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Users expect more powerful text entry as filtering seems like "too much work". They expect search to register page content and meta-data in the text they have entered, particularly in regards to the space that the page is a part of. Some even expect the order of their text to make a difference to the results. It doesn't currently register either of these points.

Discovered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Recognise space names in full text searches and prioritise results that match up to these space names.

h3. Reason for severity

This was encountered in virtually every user session I conducted around searching.
fields.summary: Searching should recognise space names and prioritise results that are contained in this space.
Change Browse Macros button to Back

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14598].
  {panel}

Viewing the Dashboard with 'My' or 'Team' spaces selected will show recently updated items for those spaces only.

Viewing the Dashboard with 'All' spaces selected will show recently updated items in all spaces, and will also show every users Status Updates.

This is potentially annoying for users, and is unintuitive:

* It is unintuitive as the status updates are unrelated to the space structure, so why would selecting different space views toggle them on and off?
* It is annoying as many users would have valid reasons for wanting to view all recently updated content in all spaces, and currently this can not be done when there are lots of Status Updates showing.

This will especially affect anonymous users, who will see all Status Updates but do not have the option of switching to 'My' or 'Team' views.

The ability to toggle Status Updates should be provided, and be separate from the existing 'All' spaces option.
fields.summary: Status updates are only shown on the Dashboard when all spaces are selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14588].
  {panel}

Currently the textarea when editing user macros (Confluence Administration > User macros) is tiny (15 rows, 50 columns). It would be much better and still fit on a typical screen if it was 30 rows by 80 columns). To change the size I edited the following files and changed the rows= and cols= parameters:-

/admin/macros/addusermacro.vm
/admin/macros/updatemacro.vm

I can now use confluence to write complex user macros without having to resort to cutting and pasting from notepad to see what the script looks like with proper indentation etc
fields.summary: User macro edit area is just to small to be usable with complex macros
Color macro should accept both US and International variants of 'colour'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14585].

h3. Problem

The "Browse Space" link is under "Add Content" in the Clickr theme. This makes no logical sense. Those looking for the link under the Browse Space section will not find it there and be temporarily deterred.
